column4: i encounter some problems trying to create an "alias" to a manual java installation. i explain my problem : i'm trying to do it using "update-alternatives --set java /usr/bin/jre" /usr/bin/jre is a "valid" link i created. but update-alternatives return this error : "update-alternatives: Cannot find alternative `/usr/bin/jre'." Does anyone know what's happen ?
pls
no idea ? ... :s
please, don't let me without help !
sudo update-alternatives --config java
but if you installed manually without a deb that won't do much I suspect
gij is found but nothing else :s
any reason why you installed manually ?
yep, i do it manually...
hum... i think it's a good didactic way :p
if you did it manually you will need symlinks
I haven't done it that way for at least 2 years ;)
but if i call /usr/bin/jre it's seems works though :/ ?
I'm sure there are howtos - the wiki page probably will tell you how
i'm just a newbie, it's a first time for me ;)
then read the wiki page I linked
much easier to just use the multiverse package for java
ok, thanks, i will go there ;)
yep, but i already know this way ;)
anyway, thanks ;)
ok, it run :) not using the way i wanted but it's ok :) (i changed the symlink under /etc/alternatives dir ;) )
hmm OK
